sentences.english: II, General Lee was in command of the air force.
sentences.chinese: 二戰期間，李將軍統率空軍部隊。

sentences.english: He assumed command of the Eighth Army.
The army is under the king's direct command.
General White was in command of the army.
sentences.chinese: 懷特將軍統率那個軍隊。

sentences.english: The King commands the armed forces.
Far as the eye can see under your command.
sentences.chinese: 是要是能看到的地方，都在你統率之下。

sentences.english: The whole army is under the marshal's command.
In World War II, General Lee was in command of the air force.
sentences.chinese: 二戰期間，李將軍統率空軍部隊。

sentences.english: General Smith is in command of the army.
The ship's captain commands all the officers and men.
sentences.chinese: 艦長統率艦上全體官兵。

sentences.english: Which officer in the ship navigates ?
sentences.chinese: 艦長統率艦上全體官兵。

sentences.english: I'm not supposed to be commanding this Army.
sentences.chinese: 我既不統率第三集團軍，也不在英國。

sentences.english: The President commands the armed forces.

definition: to plot a rebellion/to conspire against the state
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479), with capital at Nanjing
Zhu Qizhen, personal name of sixth and eighth Ming emperor Zhengtong 正統|正统[Zheng4 tong3], afterwards Tianshun Emperor 天順|天顺[Tian1 shun4] (1427-1464), reigned 1435-1449 and 1457-1464
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
to suppress by armed force/to send a punitive expedition against/to crusade against
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
